responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Command injection in deploy.sh
    analysis: |
      The `deploy.sh` script uses user-supplied environment variables `$SVN_USERNAME` and `$SVN_PASSWORD` to build and execute a shell command passed to `svn ci`, without any sanitization or validation. If an attacker is able to control the value of these environment variables, they can inject arbitrary shell commands that will be executed with the privileges of the user running the script.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - deploy.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Command injection in deploy.sh
leads.analysis: The deploy.sh script uses user-supplied environment variables $SVN_USERNAME and $SVN_PASSWORD to build and execute a shell command passed to svn ci, without any sanitization or validation. If an attacker is able to control the value of these environment variables, they can inject arbitrary shell commands that will be executed with the privileges of the user running the script.
